p: The FRAP assay was carried out using the method documented by Firuzi et al. [ 33], as adapted by Balasundram [ 32]. The original FRAP assay was developed by Benzie and Strain [ 34] as a test to measure the ferric reducing ability of plasmaâ€”i.e., the ability to reduce a ferric-2,4,6-tripyridyl- s-triazine (Fe 3+-TPTZ) to ferrous-2,4,6-tripyridyl- s-triazine (Fe 2+-TPTZ) using an electron transfer mechanism. This reduction resulted in the production of an intensely blue colored reduced complex, with maximum absorption at 593 nm [ 34]. The FRAP value of the plasma is reported in terms of mg/mL Trolox equivalents (mg/mL TE).
